reviews.review_msg: His lecture notes do not have much information; therefore, you must attend class to listen. He cares about students and is ready to give advice on studying. To get a good grade, just follow what he says during the lecture, take notes, and if you don't understand, ask him. He's always ready to explain it again until you get it.
He gives good feedback, makes everything clear and easy.

The lectures get really difficult towards the end and he has set the final exam and the project on the same day Im probably going to have to cry myself to finish the work. Thats 70% of the grade all in the same day. He also never shows you any of the exams so you dont know where you went wrong Take this class at sfu He is nice tho

Not a great option to take his class. He never goes into detail about what he wants from students; just really vague instructions. Also, only like 10% of the class can get an A so most of us aware pretty much screwed.

He's quite sensitive and he gets very irritated when a student tries to ask him a question. He rambles so much in classes. His 2 hour classes can easily be condensed into 40 minutes. He can never stay focused on one topic. He constantly jumps around. He is a nice guy and it is very easy to talk to him but he's really flighty and unfocused.
Owen is always being happy and patient to help students to succeed. He gives much effective advice for the research project and helpful feedback, which helps a lot for the psychology career

Especially bad teacher, work efficiency is very low, paper must always ask him to tell you the problem, only say one at a time, the next time ask him to tell you the next problem. The material in class is not very useful for the exam, if you want to pass it, you can only read books. A lazy teacher.
This prof is pretty rude and doesnt respect student. His attitude makes students unconfortable and even highly depressed. Never take class with him.
He is too sensitive and not open minded.

I love his voice, really soft and help you remember material immediately. Maybe because he teaches psychology, he knows how to help students study with minimum effort but gain great result. The way he teaches helps students not to feel stressful at all. You can meet him at office hour and ask for his advice to arrange schedule and reduce stress
Don;t take this course bro..
I took two of his courses. If you do your work regularly you will get good grades

Owen tells you exactly what he wants from you, so don't even go beyond that. Just follow what he asks you and you will get a good mark easily.  Most of the info he tells you in class and lectures are super interesting , so don't skip lectures.
His voice is kinda monotonous but you may be interested in the course material, which is fascinating. Ask Owen on how to write a clear essay and he will help you. Be sure to listen to his lecture

He is an attractive gentleman with high lecturing skills. His slides might be tough tho. He is friendly yo every single student(although he wont remember who u are lol). During the presentation he shows patient to every group, even though their presentation is boring and out of topic.
Very explicit in teaching. Bravo to him!!!

Do not waste your time here - this prof is someone who has been teaching the same material for so long that if you do not give him exactly what he expects to receive you will not do well. Seems to hone in on one or two students and seems to favour their attention and engages them throughout the class. I say pass and find a different prof.
The lectures are very important for you to pass the course. Anytime if you have questions on your paper, go and ask him, it's the best way to solve your problem!

If you are the type of student who comes late to class, isn't willing to go an extra mile for the essay and doesn't do weekly homework(or submits it late), then this class isn't for you! But if you can manage all the above, surely you can get a good grade.

He cracks some jokes about football and hates when you're late, so try not to do that. Overall not bad. The biggest part of this course is the research project worth 40%, and the worst part about it is there are lots of stipulations - you can't pick any experiment you want. Kind of limiting. Lectures are pretty chill, though. Read the textbook.

Do not choose his course.  He has no respect to students at all. Worst professor I have ever met so far.  You have to beg for his help or he will never help. Poor attitudes and he has really low EQ, very easy to be pissed off. Lectures notes are not useful as the textbook. Read the text in very detail then u will pass this course.
Bad prof, never use internet, no ppt send to student, just show in class. No useful text book, everything you need take from class.
Very interesting lectures. He makes it very clear what we need to study for exams. Sends lecture notes to our emails. Awesome teacher!

Really nice prof!! He was willing to help students who struggled with their research papers, and even gave extra assistance to students whose first language is not English!! Patient and gave useful feedback.
The course is not easy. U have to create an experiment and write a big paper on it. The exams are hard as well.

Good lecturer as he is very clear and he makes sure you understand the material. But can be repetitive. Made it quite interesting. Exams are hard if you don't study the text and the notes but it isn't hard to do well. Coming up with a topic for the paper was difficult. My advice: be as specific as you can or your topic will be rejected.

One of the most honest professor in the whole school! He is very strict but really really nice person. If you put in the hours to study, you'll do fine on the exams. The essays are marked very strict, but its 40%, so put your effort! Text book is a must n lectures are also a must!

He is great. yes he is very strict on the audience and the value of your work. if 
 If you're the type of person who late , even if 5 minutes, I advise you not to take with him, he is very good and gentle with the students who come on time, handed assignments on a time. I will take another course with him

Took this class at Harbour Centre with a smaller class size and he was a very approachable prof. Take notes on what he says because they will definitely be on the exam. He tells you which slides will be tested so no surprises but he is a REALLY hard marker on the tests and research paper. Summaries are due every week so be ready to write a lot.

A very time-consuming but interesting course! Be prepared to do a LOT of writing. Professor mainly reads off lecture slides but occasionally throws in his own witty comments to keep people from falling asleep. TA was very informative and helpful. If you are interested in psychology, take this course :)
Good teaching method but he a hard marker. Answer in exam have to be exactly the same as the notes or marks will not be given. And he hate ppl late for class

Professor's lectures were interesting but the TA's have way too much power and control over your grades. The TA  Jordan S. marking was inconsistent and unfair. The midterm is only 50 minutes to write about 17 short answer questions with a complete well structured essay. Very disorganized class and unclear instructions on assignments.

The course itself was average, put in time youll do fine. You have to conduct, present and submit a psyc research study. Apart from the class, this guy is a jerk, I really don't know what his problem is. Hes so paranoid that people will cheat in his class that he takes ridiculous measures during exams. One of the only classes Ive dreaded so much.
Good prof b/c he is clear and concise. Arrogant sometimes. Writing intensive course. Just follow instructions and it will be okay.

Class is mandatory, doesn't post notes or use webct. Posts grades in office. Said final exam was cumulative but only few pre-midterm questions. Don?t wear hats, sweatshirts or long sleeves to his exams because he will make you take your clothes off and write the exam in your underwear. He?s fishy. How well you do on final project depends on TA.

his exams are irrelevant to his lectures but really easy. I got 54/60 and DID NOT attend his lectures once. The only reason people are doing so bad in this class is that you'll have to write a research paper with no specific instructions or guidelines. no wonder the class average is so low. IF WRITING IS NOT YOUR THING, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS.

well, he is great if you find him for help on the research paper. he applied lots of restriction on the paper, so if you can't think psychologically, don't take this class, you will be suffering on searching for relevant idea and getting it passed.

Everyone did well on the exam, and since it's curved, doesn't mean much. Boring, monotone, and repeats the same information that we already knew from previous chapters. I don't understand why we review the same stuff over and over. Arrogant when answering questions

This is the BEST prof I have had so far.1.His lecture is EXTREMELY useful;2.Very responsible, willing to provide extra help;3.Midterm is fair(you HAVE to pay attention in class and GET YOUR PEN ready to copy down his KEYPOINT, whatever he said is important IS GOING TO BE ON THE TEST,if you skip one class,u lose5%on ur final<-my prediction.GOODLUCK!
He's really willing to help students when they ask for help. Very clear. Lectures are very well organized. Wish he taught some of the upper level courses, but sadly I don't think he does.. :(

Boring and uses monotone when he talks. Boring to listen to. Does not use WebCT so have to attend lecture to get notes or else you're done for. Nice but arrogant at the same time. TA seemed to be more helpful than him. Not a bad prof though.

Nice guy, and is really good at getting his point across. that being said, extremely hard marker for essays! almost impossible to get a good mark simply because he feels that kind of writing cannot come from a university student. too many weekly writing assignments and he can be arrogant when discussing marks. but the course topics are interesting!
Best TA: Attila!

Dont bother following the text reading list, material is presented all over the place. Exams dont consist of any eg he presents in lecture. You can get away self-teaching by reading the text, lec attendance is a waste. Kind of jerk when u ask a question. Will patronize u in front of class. Unorganized and technologically incompetent.

Speaks ridiculously slowly and is unbelievably boring to listen to. Doesn't use WebCT, so you get a bunch of handouts or emails that only reach half the class because of inadequate email lists. Gives short notice about written assignment. Exams are easy.

He is a really good professor. Gets straight to the point. The TA is WONDERFUL (Kelly). She is not the easiest marker but she is very approachable and very kind. The exam was fair. He tells you what is expected and tells you to write to stuff down during lecture if he is going to test you on it. Heavy course load but learned a lot :) Very interesti

Nice guy. Willing to help his students. Course materials are interesting. The work load for this course is heavy. Summaries almost every single week and a large research paper consists of many components. His exams are okay as long as you study his power point slides. Attendance is certainly mandatory and you can do better if you attend classes.
amazing prof. very patient and helpful.

Good to know I wasn't the only one with a secret crush on him! He definitely wants every student to do their best. He's always in a pleasant mood and doesn't mind repeating things that weren't made clear enough the first time. If you can, take a course with Owen. He's a great prof!

Awesome professor! I wasn't initially interested in or excited about taking this course, but he made it a pleasure. Takes his time explaining concepts, and encourages questions. Also, really seems like he cares about the students and our success in the course. Highly recommended - he's cute too!

Awesome Prof ever! He speaks so clearly and slowly then repeats few times of what he've said so everyone could copy the notes on the overhead and what he said at the same time! Good powerpoints as well. He is very nice too!
Good course, good prof. Highly recommended.
Interesting course. The small class size made for a good learning experience. Owen was great. I loved this course.

I took this course at harbour centre and I can honestly say that this is the best class I have ever taken. Owen is such a good prof. He treated us with so much respect. The material in this course is also very interesting. I highly recommend this course, and Owen
Awesome prof! Super helpful and he knows the material. I learnt a lot from his class. he makes things clear and will go over things slowly.

Not a very good prof. He doesn't convey information to students clearly. He is quiet, slow and plus very monotone in his lectures. He did provide a lot of examples which is great but it's hard to concentrate in his class. I would avoid taking a class with him in the future.
Helpful teacher. He will spend time with you if you go to his office. I learned alot from talking to him.
The material is fairly boring, but it is a methods course! I enjoyed the lectures for the most part. Sometimes a little dry but not the profs fault. good prof.

holy crap! make sure you LOVE psych to take this course. the materials are brutal and confusing! he is the most montoned person i've ever had to listen to. however, hes nice, friendly, funny, and he tells you what he wants from you on midterms and assigns. mabye sure to drink coffee before this class because you might fall asleep
Good! funny at times too. he seems interested in the material, which can be a little boring,it is a methods course after all.nice blue shoes!:)
he talks so slow during class!!!!! you're going to fall asleep!
Awesome! Clear lectures tho I wish he posted his notes on line. Not 2 bad tho because he does'nt have many lecture slides. Midterm was easy! Cute and rides a motorcycle too!!
No Comments

A decent teacher. Spoke much too slowly, however, and classes ended up taking twice as long as necessary. His tests were reasonable, with a few exceptions. Too many "none of the above" mc/ questions were ambiguous, and the essay question in the final was truly incomprehensible. It didn't even make gramatical or conceptual sense.

he is a nice guys who makes that course very easy, his exam includes mc and short questions but mainly focuses on the lecture notes (about 80%). for the eassy, he is cocusing on your effort, because no matter your argument is right or wrong, as long as you find proper quotes to support your idea, you will be fine.the eassy is more like free writing
Very helpful in office hour and open to listen to different interesting comments. Good looking prof!!!
Owne is a excellent teacher! he makes learning fun. Clear on what he wants and u can ask him for help as much as u want and he will be patient with u. Great prof.
Great being in his class.  Very clear and helpful.  Really nice to have a teacher who seems like they care about the students
very helpful, very clear and approachable. easy on the eyes too!
Great prof! Pay most attention to lectures and take great notes - most questions on exams are from there. Very helpful and dedicated to students.
No Comments
Nice guy, did okay for his first time teaching.  Will be an excellent prof with some experience.  He really cared about his students and wasn't out to surprise anyone.
No Comments
No Comments
